item.title: Melody add a quote by Humbert Wolfe
item.description: "Listen! The wind is rising, and the air is wild with leaves, We have had our summer evenings, now for October eves!" -- Humbert Wolfe

item.title: Melody add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Melody add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "The love of learning, the sequestered nooks, And all the sweet serenity of books" -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Melody add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Melody add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Melody add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "My grandma always said that God made libraries so that people didn't have any excuse to be stupid." -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Melody add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Melody add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Melody add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "The library is inhabited by spirits that come out of the pages at night." -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Melody add a quote by John Witherspoon
item.description: "Never read a book through merely because you have begun it." -- John Witherspoon

item.title: Melody add a quote by Harold Bloom
item.description: "Reading well is one of the great pleasures that solitude can afford you." -- Harold Bloom

item.title: Melody add a quote by Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis
item.description: "There are many little ways to enlarge your child's world. Love of books is the best of all." -- Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis

item.title: Melody add a quote by Richard Paul Evans
item.description: "Books are the most tolerant of friends." -- Richard Paul Evans

item.title: Melody add a quote by Anne Herbert
item.description: "Libraries will get you through times of no money better than money will get you through times of no libraries." -- Anne Herbert

item.title: Melody add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Melody add a quote by Elizabeth Kostova
item.description: "It was good to walk into a library again; it smelled like home." -- Elizabeth Kostova

item.title: Melody add a quote by Elizabeth Kostovia
item.description: "When you handle books all day long, every new one is a friend and a temptation." -- Elizabeth Kostovia

item.title: Melody add a quote by Amos Bronson Alcott
item.description: "Good books, like good friends, are few and chosen; the more select, the more enjoyable." -- Amos Bronson Alcott

item.title: Melody add a quote by Daniel Pennac
item.description:
"Reader's Bill of Rights
1. The right to not read
2. The right to skip pages
3. The right to not finish
4. The right to reread
5. The right to read anything
6. The right to escapism
7. The right to read anywhere
8. The right to browse
9. The right to read out loud
10. The right to not defend your tastes" -- Daniel Pennac

item.title: Melody add a quote by Charles Ogden
item.description: "Don't mark up the Library's copy, you fool! Librarians are Unprankable. They'll track you down! They have skills!" -- Charles Ogden

item.title: Melody add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Melody add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Melody add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Melody add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Melody add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Melody add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Melody add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Melody add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Melody add a quote by Confucious
item.description: "Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life." -- Confucious

item.title: Melody add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis
